dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, Host_B, big news coming out of Washington this week, uh, regarding Hong Kong.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Host B, big news coming out of Washington this week, uh, regarding Hong Kong.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I saw that. Trump actually, like, vetoed *the* Hong Kong bill? I mean, I thought that was kinda surprising, given all the, you know, US support for the democracy movement there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I saw that. Trump actually, like, vetoed the Hong Kong bill? I mean, I thought that was kinda surprising, given all the, you know, U S support for the democracy movement there.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Donald Trump signed a bill on Wednesday that supports the pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong, after days of uncertainty surrounding his willingness to confront Beijing as he attempts to hammer out a trade deal with China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? It was, um, the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act. And he vetoed it on Wednesday, despite it actually passing with, like, overwhelming bipartisan support in both houses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? It was, um, the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act. And he vetoed it on Wednesday, despite it actually passing with, like, overwhelming bipartisan support in both houses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Donald Trump signed a bill on Wednesday that supports the pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong... The bill, the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act, was passed almost unanimously by both houses of Congress last week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Wow, okay. So, why? I mean, it's gotta be about that trade deal with China, right? He's really trying to finalize that.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow, okay. So, why? I mean, it's gotta be about that trade deal with China, right? He's really trying to finalize that.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Until today it was unclear if Trump would sign the bill into law. The president has been relatively silent on Hong Kong as he negotiates a trade deal with Chinas President Xi Jinping.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. That's, like, the big backdrop here. He's trying to avoid confrontation. He even said, um, the bill would lead to "perpetual conflict and economic depression."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. That's, like, the big backdrop here. He's trying to avoid confrontation. He even said, um, the bill would lead to perpetual conflict and economic depression.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In a statement announcing the signing, Trump said he signed the bill out of respect for President Xi, China and the people of Hong Kong. They are being enacted in the hope that Leaders and Representatives of China and Hong Kong will be able to amicably settle their differences leading to long-term peace and prosperity for all.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Perpe-- Really? But what was the bill even *doing*, exactly? I thought it was about, you know, holding Beijing accountable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Perpe-- Really? But what was the bill even doing, exactly? I thought it was about, you know, holding Beijing accountable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: It was! The bill would have mandated sanctions against officials violating human rights in Hong Kong, and, uh, required the State Department to report on Hong Kong's autonomy. So, you know, actual tools for oversight.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It was! The bill would have mandated sanctions against officials violating human rights in Hong Kong, and, uh, required the State Department to report on Hong Kong's autonomy. So, you know, actual tools for oversight.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: It would mandate that the president impose sanctions against people found to be violating human rights in Hong Kong and require the State Department to give Congress annual reports assessing whether China has encroached on Hong Kongs autonomy or clamped down on civil liberties.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so he vetoed *that*. That really changes things.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so he vetoed that. That really changes things.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: President Donald Trump signed a bill on Wednesday that supports the pro-democracy protests in Hong Kong

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah. And that's why Senator Marco Rubio, who actually championed this bill, is now expressing concern. He said, um, the US now has "no new and meaningless tools to encourage further influence and interference from Beijing into Hong Kong's internal affairs."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah. And that's why Senator Marco Rubio, who actually championed this bill, is now expressing concern. He said, um, the U S now has no new and meaningless tools to encourage further influence and interference from Beijing into Hong Kong's internal affairs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The U.S. now has new and meaningful tools to deter further influence and interference from Beijing into Hong Kongs internal affairs, said Senator Marco Rubio, who introduced the bill.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, essentially, by vetoing it, we're, like, just giving Beijing more room to, you know, do whatever they want?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, essentially, by vetoing it, we're, like, just giving Beijing more room to, you know, do whatever they want?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: That's the implication, yeah. And it comes right after those recent Hong Kong elections, which, ironically, had, um, record voter turnout, showing really strong pro-democracy sentiment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's the implication, yeah. And it comes right after those recent Hong Kong elections, which, ironically, had, um, record voter turnout, showing really strong pro-democracy sentiment.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Following last weekends historic elections in Hong Kong that included record turnout, this new law could not be more timely in showing strong U.S. support for Hong Kongers long-cherished freedoms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [overlaps] Right? So it's, like, really ill-timed for showing US opposition to Hong Kongers' freedoms.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? So it's, like, really ill-timed for showing U S opposition to Hong Kongers' freedoms.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. It just, uh, underlines the struggle there. Remember how these protests even started months ago, with that extradition bill?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. It just, uh, underlines the struggle there. Remember how these protests even started months ago, with that extradition bill?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Pro-democracy protests erupted in the semiautonomous region of Hong Kong months ago over a bill that would extradite those accused of committing a crime in Hong Kong to mainland China.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, yeah. The one where people were worried it would be used to, um, protect political allies in mainland China.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, yeah. The one where people were worried it would be used to, um, protect political allies in mainland China.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The worry was the law would be used to crack down on political opponents.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And now, you know, this veto kinda just adds another layer to Beijing's perceived control over the city, or at least, uh, a lack of strong US opposition to it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And now, you know, this veto kinda just adds another layer to Beijing's perceived control over the city, or at least, uh, a lack of strong U S opposition to it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a complicated message, for sure.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a complicated message, for sure.
